p: The ethyl acetate fraction also contained the flavonol quercetin ( 28) and several of its derivatives ( 18, 19, 23, 25, 26, 27 and 28). Quercetin ( 28) was identified based on its pseudomolecular ion at m/ z 301.03 and fragment ions at m/ z 271, 255, 179 and 151 [ 36]. Compound 18, with pseudomolecular ion at m/ z 615.0997, displayed fragment ions at m/ z 463 for [M-H-169] −, indicating loss of a galloyl moiety, and at m/ z 301 for [M-H-331] −, indicating an additional loss of a hexoxyl moiety. Compound 18 was thus deduced to be quercetin- O-galloylhexoside, based on these data and data reported by Mendes et al. [ 26].
